description: Underwater beats for clear reefs and sunlit dives - soundtrack for snorkeling Costa Rica.

items.name: Cahuita National Park, Limon Province
items.description: Cahuita National Park is where you'll witness the most extensive coral reefs on the eastern coast of the country. The vibrant coral reefs and a large group of fishes swimming past you are a spectacle to watch, you can also witness giant barramundi, stingrays and reef sharks. White sand beaches, turquoise waters, and a diverse marine life await you in Cahuita National Park located in the province of Limon. Get to know the best-preserved coral reef in the Costa Rican Caribbean and enjoy the landscape of this beautiful country.
items.location_hint: Cahuita National Park, Av. 71 215, Limón, Costa Rica

items.name: Snorkel Adventure Costa Rica
items.description: Enjoy an exhilarating snorkeling session of about one hour where you will be submerged into the water and snorkel around the volcanic rocks. This beach stands out for a variety of fish and marine species located along the coast of Manuel Antonio which is approximately two hours away from Marina Pez Vela of Quepos. You will be transported to the snorkeling site in a 31 ft boat and snorkel around the Biezans beach. After a break of indulging in some fruits and water to re-energize yourself, you will be taken to another snorkeling site where you will witness different species altogether. Carry a bathing suit, a towel and sunscreen with you as you'll be spending the entire day out in the sun.
items.location_hint: Snorkel Adventure Costa Rica, Puntarenas Province, Quepos, Costa Rica

items.name: Isla del Cano
items.location_hint: Isla del Cano, Osa, Costa Rica

items.name: Cocos Island National Park
items.location_hint: Cocos Island National Park, approximately 550 km off the shore of Costa Rica

items.name: Marino Ballena National Park
items.location_hint: Marino Ballena National Park, Bahia Ballena, Provincia de Puntarenas, Uvita, 60504, Costa Rica

items.name: Gandoca – Manzanillo National Wildlife Refuge
items.description: Known to be one of the best snorkeling spots on the Caribbean coast, this is a popular spot again amongst divers and snorkeling enthusiasts, the sea lovers and the water babies looking for a perfect opportunity to dive into the ocean waters and witness a miracle. The shallow coral reefs, little islands, the white sand and turquoise clear water of the Gandoca-Manzanillo National Wildlife Refuge all blend in to create a perfect opportunity to explore the magical underwater world and the beautiful marine life. Let the magic unfold in front of your eyes as these whimsical creatures swim past you. A myriad of colourful tropical fishes, corals, dolphins and sea turtles will bless you with their presence in this beautiful wildlife refuge.
items.location_hint: Gandoca-Manzanillo National Wildlife Refuge, 36, Limón Province, Costa Rica
